intro: Chiococca auyantepuiensis, commonly known as the Angel's Trumpet of the Gran Sabana, is a species of flowering plant native to the tepuis of South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically orange or yellow. The plant is a climbing shrub with thick, fleshy stems and elliptical leaves. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is adapted to the unique ecological conditions of the tepuis. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
